title: Question 11
prompt:
Sentence 17: Cover it with cool, moist, sterile bandages, and elevate it above the heart if possible.

Which correction should be made to sentence 17?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
It is unclear in this sentence what the word “it” refers to. The previous sentence mentions “cloth” and “material” as well as “wound,” but the nearest nouns are “victim,” “smoke,” “heat,” and “smoldering materials.” It’s somewhat unclear what “it” the writer means. The best solution is to replace “it” with a noun to clarify the meaning. In this case, the writer means “the burn.”


Do not remove cloth or material if its stuck to the wound, but make sure the victim is not exposed to smoke, heat, or smoldering materials. Cover the burn with cool, moist, sterile bandages, and elevate it above the heart if possible.
